Under Section 51 of the Lisbon treaty, foreign nationals being arrested or detained abroad within Europe must show "reasonable legal certainty" that they will avoid being extradited. The process of being tried in their native country is usually lengthy, but it is often accompanied by a court hearing or court order. A conviction is punishable by a fine of up to £18,000 – in many countries – whereas in Turkey or in Italy, the maximum fine may reach as high as £3600.
